title: C9 with Baron turret diving CLG
body:
Like idk why Hai did that call? 
They would of at least maybe won the game if they just push with Baron instead of fighting with the Baron buff

replies.body:
Hai is a good shotcaller; he isn't a perfect one.

He messed up. It was a bad call. Happens to the best.

> [{quoted}](name=PartyPanda12,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=MvlNb7jd,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-02-29T16:01:05.310+0000)
>
> Hai is a good shotcaller; he isn't a perfect one.
> 
> He messed up. It was a bad call. Happens to the best.

This.

Also, that Bard ult was disgusting, disabling the front carry but not hitting Hai. Ridiculous. Aphromoo is a god.

It was actually a good call but the Bard ult was PERFECT and ruined the whole teamfight for C9. If Aphro messes up that ult C9 probably wins the game right then and there, but he nailed it and showed why Bard has OP potential in the right hands.

They pushed the issue btw because they had a team fight comp, they knew Jax would TP in and wanted him to - they wanted him to stop split pushing.
he just made a bad call and picked a fight that he thought they could win but they lost it. It happens.

Really that one team fight was lost almost entirely on aphro's amazing bard play. Before the tower dive even started, he landed a stun on Sneaky right outside of turret range. If Sneaky had gotten in an extra auto attack or two on the tower before the dive started, I don't think bard ult saves the turret and Darshan's TP doesn't come in. Then after the fight started, he managed to bait Sneaky into attacking him for a second or two, and not attacking darshan to save Jensen.

I think C9 made the right call. Aphro's bard, and Sneaky/Jensen being just a tad too far forward is why C9 lost that fight in my opinion.

Amazing game, awesome fight. I'm still salty C9 lost :(
It was an OK call but the Bard ult landed in a way that made an ok call into a really bad one. It's a shame really
It was a call to win the game. Jax was a ticking time bomb. They had to take the fight, but CLG played it super well. With how snowbally games are now it was the end.

I cant fault them too much. I respect teams who go for the win, instead of grinding it out for another 10 minutes. C9 went for the win. If Aphro's bard ult wasn't perfect, they probably won right there. Hell, if Xmithie didnt get caught in it, they prob. still won. Him surviving was the biggest issue. If he was still outside it, they would have burst him down, and it probably won the 4v4 after Zion Tp'd. Instead, they tunneled on Xmithie, he still lived, and then it was a 5v4.

Yes, they culd have just took the turret, and then the inhib, and probably won the game later. but they went for the win then. I dont think it was the worst call. Xmithie was pretty much dead. He was caught, dead, and it was prob. over. Just that perfect bard ult. Hell,

Sneaky positioned too aggressively after the bard ult went down. Basically he dashes out of the bard ult and then walks back to where the bard ult would have put him if it hit him anyway.

He gets hit by Jax stun because he ran up to melee range udyr thinking they could burst him down and then uses his dash to jump onto Huhi (who flashes away) when he could have just stayed back and focused down the Jax then Corki. He even starts hitting the bard for a little bit ??? literally the lowest priority target.

Worth noting that he could have just shredded the Jax as he already used his dodge ability and had almost no armor AND was focused on the leblanc who would have survived to burst down the back line if he would have focused Jax.

It is weird to single out one player but their teamfight was built around him in this comp so he really has to position well and prioritize targets correctly for it to work.

They had just chunked out Xmithie.  I don't think it was designed to be a dive it just turned into a fight after Aphromoo got the Bard ult on the tower, Xmithie and one of the C9 players.  At that point, CLG engaged and C9 couldn't disengage.

Jensen was supposed to body those fools.
But he didn't.
